Utterance: <synch>
Hi again! It’s great to see you. How have you been doing since our last session?
I’ve been doing well! I started walking three days a week like we discussed.
That’s fantastic! How has that been for you?
It feels great to be active again. I even joined a local gym to mix things up.
Wow, that’s a big step! How has the gym experience been?
It’s been good! I’m still getting used to it, but I’m enjoying the classes they offer.
That’s wonderful to hear! Have you met anyone new there?
A couple of people, yes. It’s nice to have a little social interaction outside of work.
That’s great! Social connections can be really beneficial for your overall well-being. Any other changes you’ve noticed?
I think I’m sleeping a bit better. I feel more tired at night, but in a good way.
That’s excellent! Physical activity can really help with sleep quality. Have you been meditating as well?
Yes, I’ve kept up with that too. I think it helps me unwind after my workouts.
That’s a great combination! It sounds like you’re really taking care of yourself. How has your relationship with your mom been?
It’s been good. We spend more time together, and I think she appreciates the help with her garden.
That’s lovely! It sounds like you’re both benefiting from your time together. What about your wife? Have you had a chance to talk about your relationship?
We had a good conversation last weekend. We talked about setting aside time for each other.
That’s a positive step forward! How did that conversation go?
It went well. We both agreed to be more open and honest about our feelings.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like you’re making progress. Do you feel more hopeful about the future of your relationship?
Yes, I do. I think we’re both willing to work on it, which is a good sign.
Absolutely! It’s important that both of you are committed to the process. Is there anything specific you want to focus on in your next conversation?
I think we need to discuss our expectations and boundaries moving forward.
That sounds like a crucial topic. Would you like to brainstorm some points to bring up?
Yes, that would be helpful. I want to be clear about what I need from her too.
Great! Let’s start by identifying a couple of your key needs in the relationship.
I need more communication and reassurance. I want to feel valued and heard.
Those are important needs. How might you express those to her?
I think I can tell her that I appreciate her support and that I need to feel more connected.
That’s a wonderful approach. It’s clear and constructive. How do you feel about bringing that up?
I feel a bit nervous, but I think it’s necessary.
It’s completely normal to feel nervous. Just remember to approach it calmly and with an open heart. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that covers a lot. I’m feeling good about where I’m at right now.
That’s great to hear! I’m proud of the progress you’ve made. Let’s check in next time about how your conversation goes with your wife.
Yes, I’m looking forward to it. Thank you!
You’re welcome! Take care until next time.
Bye!
Bye!
